title: Stock Futures Falter as Post-Fed Rally Fades
sub_head: Rate-sensitive technology stocks are set to lead losses on Wall Street after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates
body:
U.S. stock futures and global indexes slumped, suggesting Wall Street’s post-Fed meeting rally wasn’t set to last.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 dropped 2.4% on Thursday, a day after the broad index rallied 1.5% to halt a five-day losing streak. Blue-chip Dow Jones Industrial Average Futures lost 1.8% while Nasdaq-100 futures plummeted 2.8%, putting technology stocks on course for steep losses after the opening bell.
